content.text:
I'll start by exploring the repository structure to understand the codebase and prepare for any implementation tasks.
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros -type f -name "*.md" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cat /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/README.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">git -C /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros log --oneline -10</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/src -type f | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">tree -L 3 /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/src 2>/dev/null || find /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/src -type d | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Repository Warmup Complete

I've successfully explored the **ClankerOS** repository. Here's what I found:

**Project Overview:**
- **Project**: ClankerOS - An operating system kernel project
- **Status**: Active development (main branch)
- **Recent Work**: 
  - Session 2 documentation added
  - Coding style guide created
  - Multiboot header fixes
  - GDT, IDT, ISR, and early console support implemented
  - Integration with libclankercommon printf

**Repository Structure:**
- Main source code in `/src` directory with kernel components
- Recent additions include documentation in `/docs`
- Website setup files in `/docs` 
- Scripts for tooling (Markdown conversion, website generation)
- Makefile-based build system
- Style guide and documentation standards in place

**Recent Git Activity:**
The repository shows active development with commits focusing on low-level kernel infrastructure (bootloader, interrupt handling, memory management).

**Current State:**
- Git status shows modified files (.gitignore, Makefile)
- Untracked files include documentation setup, website files, and scripts
- Main branch is clean and ready for new work

I'm now ready to tackle any implementation tasks. Please provide the specific requirements you'd like me to design a plan for.
